I was wondering what cyber diva was.

Honestly out of the english vocaloids cyber diva sounds the best cause well it's the latest version and it doesn't have mispronunciations like the previous ones had.

Listening to cyber diva in a year or two considering how it sounds better vocaloids *might* catch on in the west cause it sounds better than past english vocaloids.

Oliver was alright, but he still sounded massively robotic.

Cyber diva while still sounds robotic does sound significantly better.  Personally I think in a year or two at this rate it might finally catch on.  The reason why I'm excited about the latest ones is think how nuts japan is towards miku; wouldn't that be cool to see it that popular in the states?

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f00a2c6368722217960400#post_54f00a2c6368722217960400
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f009f163687244a72a0400#post_54f009f163687244a72a0400
That would be super cool.[/bq]
Avoiding the weaboo comments cyber diva not having a anime avatar isn't a bad choice either.
*dodges bullet*
Why?  Cause it would be covertly introducing geek culture into the mainstream.  I support the new ones sounding more human and less anime style for the english ones because they're doing things that are good decisions.

They dropped the anime avatars meaning "moral guardians" can't bitch and moan; they made it sound more human meaning more people might in the long run be interested by vocaloids; they are trying to make people take it seriously and such.

Vocaloids *might* become super popular in the states, but I doubt miku or such will be as popular in the states; rather chances are the most popular vocaloids in the states will probably be english vocaloids.

Upside:
Vocaloids *might* become super popular in the states.
Downside:
Chances are the ones that will become popular will be english vocaloids instead.

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f00ba7636872425b0d0200#post_54f00ba7636872425b0d0200
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f00b156368726e52ec0c00#post_54f00b156368726e52ec0c00
I can already see a bunch of vocalists getting super pissed off but producers are gonna be fucking ecstatic.[/bq]
I fucking take it back; it'll definitely become popular cause chances are producers are going to jump all the fuck over that when the english ones start sounding realistically human.
